abstract: Adam Davidson On Money column examines efficacy of complicated 2010 Dodd-Frank regulations in reigning in bad behavior on part of banks; submits banks are extremely difficult to regulate because their importance to society grants them leverage; holds best way to improve regulatory system is to simplify it.
lead_paragraph: The regulation of banks is an impossible conundrum, because society cannot function without them, and the banks know it.

headline.main: Wall Street Is Using the Power of Dodd-Frank Against Itself
headline.print_headline: Wall Street Is Using the Power of Dodd-Frank Against Itself

snippet: The regulation of banks is an impossible conundrum, because society cannot function without them, and the banks know it.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
